title: LEARN Topics and Deep-Dives
description: Below are a collection of videos on different topics. Some are introductions and some are deep-dives.

topics.title: Small Group Collaboration in a Hybrid Class
topics.description: Encourage active learning in your hybrid classes by using collaboration tools such as murals and Zoom breakout rooms.
topics.content: A hybrid class presents an opportunity for you to foster creativity and collaboration among your students. Using group collaboration tools, you can split your in-person and online students into small groups to work on contributing to a shared resource, such as a mural or Google Doc. In this video, we will show you how to split your students into small groups and how to set up a Mural for your students to develop. If you need more help on how create and manage breakout rooms in Zoom, please see this video demonstration.
topics.author:
Brian LaDuca and Adrienne Ausdenmoore
Institute of Applied Creativity for Transformation (IACT)

topics.title: Intrinsic Motivation & Course Communication
topics.description: Incorporating the ARCS method of motivation into your course communications to help increase student intrinsic motivation.
topics.content: Students are more successful in courses where they have a higher level of intrinsic motivation. The ARCS Model of Motivation focuses on Attention, Relevance, Confidence, and Satisfaction. In this video we talk about a very simple way to incorporate ARCS components into your course communication to increase student intrinsic motivation.
topics.author: Office of eLearning

videos.title: Student Intrinsic Motivation and Course Communication

topics.title: Beat the Boss Monster!
topics.description: Enhance course engagement and learning outcomes using gamification techniques.
topics.content: Games operate off of fairly simple mechanics - beat the boss monster, save the world - yet they offer some of the most engaging and immersive learning experiences on the planet. Join Instructional Designer Kent Darr to discuss three gamification techniques that you can build into your course to enhance engagement and learning outcomes while also preparing students to be a source of common good now and after graduation.
topics.author: Office of eLearning
